result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas L Albrecht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to 15cf350.
2-3-17:  Probation is extended for 1 year, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

miscConds.notes: Ct signed order.  $1409.10 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

$253 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment or be seeking same.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JK. Defn not to work in a job that handles money, financial documents, or merchandise.
Defn to file tax returns each year with a copy to agent & any refunds to restitution. Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on March 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with US Cellular.
  Trial Judge - Br 12

Defendant appeared.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant did not appear.  Mary Ellen Karst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant and copy of Complaint given to State to attempt to serve.
